meta.creation_note: Documented fictional creation by artist Trevor Henderson in 2018. Not a real cryptid despite some belief claims.

description.summary: A 40-foot tall humanoid creature with sirens for a head, created by horror artist Trevor Henderson in 2018. The character mimics voices and emergency broadcasts to lure victims. Despite being documented as fictional art, Sirenhead has spawned belief claims, video games, and widespread internet folklore.
description.full: Sirenhead is a horror character created by Canadian artist Trevor Henderson in 2018 through digital artwork posted to social media. The creature is depicted as an approximately 40-foot tall, skeletal humanoid with mummified skin and two sirens or megaphones where a head should be. According to Henderson's fiction, Sirenhead can mimic human voices, animal sounds, and emergency broadcasts with perfect accuracy to lure victims. It possesses immense strength, moves with disturbing silence despite its size, and inhabits rural areas and forests. The character went viral in 2018-2019, inspiring video games, YouTube videos, and extensive fan content. Despite Henderson clearly stating Sirenhead is his fictional creation, some claim to have witnessed it, and it's often confused with SCP Foundation content (it is NOT an SCP). Sirenhead represents modern cryptid creation via internet art, tapping into anxieties about emergency broadcast systems, rural isolation, and the uncanny valley. The phenomenon demonstrates how internet-native characters can blur the line between acknowledged fiction and pseudo-cryptid belief.

etymology.origin: Named for the sirens/megaphones that replace its head

related_phenomena.name: Slenderman
related_phenomena.description: Earlier internet-created cryptid (2009), similar viral spread

related_phenomena.name: The Rake
related_phenomena.description: Creepypasta creature with similar internet origins

related_phenomena.name: Trevor Henderson creatures
related_phenomena.description: Cartoon Cat, Long Horse, Bridge Worm, etc.

related_phenomena.name: SCP Foundation
related_phenomena.description: Sirenhead is NOT an SCP despite common misconception

creator.name: Trevor Henderson
creator.statement: Trevor Henderson has confirmed Sirenhead is his fictional artistic creation, not a real cryptid

physical.limbs: Extremely long arms and legs, thin but powerful
physical.head: Two sirens or megaphones mounted on neck in place of head

features.description: Two sirens or megaphones, can rotate independently
Approximately 40 feet tall, towers over trees

abilities.description: Can mimic any human voice, animal sound, or audio with perfect accuracy
Can broadcast emergency alert sounds, sirens, air raid warnings
abilities.purpose: Cause panic, draw people out of safety

abilities.description: Despite massive size, moves with disturbing quietness
Can tear apart structures, vehicles, crush with ease
Tracks prey through sound, uses audio to manipulate

behavior.habitat: Rural areas, forests, abandoned places, isolated roads
behavior.hunting_method: Lures victims with mimicked sounds or emergency broadcasts
patterns: Uses familiar voices to lure victims
Plays emergency broadcasts to cause panic
Implied to feed on or kill victims

origin.creator: Trevor Henderson
origin.original_post: Digital artwork showing tall creature with sirens for head in rural setting

timeline.significance: Character first appears as digital horror art
Image spreads rapidly, people create fan content
Multiple indie horror games feature Sirenhead
Gaming channels, horror channels, creepypasta readings
Many incorrectly believe Sirenhead is an SCP
Artist confirms fictional status, not SCP
Despite fictional status, some claim to have seen it

creation_history.evolution: Sirenhead evolved from single artwork to viral internet cryptid, inspiring games, videos, and belief claims despite documented fictional origin

scp_confusion.claim: Many believe Sirenhead is part of SCP Foundation
scp_confusion.reality: Sirenhead is NOT an SCP, it's Trevor Henderson's personal creation
scp_confusion.why_confused: Similar internet horror aesthetic, both feature monsters
scp_confusion.henderson_clarification: Henderson has stated Sirenhead is his own work, not SCP

why_effective.description: Taps into fear of emergency alert systems, EAS scenarios
why_effective.cultural_context: Emergency alerts associated with danger, nuclear warnings, disasters

why_effective.description: Humanoid but wrong, familiar emergency equipment on alien body
why_effective.effect: Deeply unsettling, triggers primal fear response

why_effective.description: Plays on fear of being alone on country roads, isolated forests
why_effective.effect: Heightened vulnerability, no escape or help

why_effective.description: Mimicry of loved ones, emergency sirens creates paranoia
why_effective.effect: Can't trust what you hear, psychological manipulation

why_effective.description: 40-foot height makes it impossible to fight or escape

merchandise.note: Much merchandise produced without Henderson's permission

sightings.reality: Despite being documented fictional creation (2018), some people claim sightings
sightings.note: Unlike Slenderman which some believed was ancient folklore, Sirenhead's 2018 creation is well-documented

slenderman.similarity: Internet-created horror entity, viral spread, games and content
slenderman.difference: Slenderman (2009) had 'ancient folklore' framing, Sirenhead known as 2018 art
slenderman.lesson: Both show internet can create pseudo-cryptids

scp_foundation.similarity: Internet horror, detailed lore, creature documentation
scp_foundation.difference: SCP is collaborative fiction wiki, Sirenhead is single artist's creation
scp_foundation.confusion: Many wrongly think Sirenhead is SCP-6789 (it's not)

trevor_henderson_universe.relationship: Sirenhead is one of many creatures Henderson created
trevor_henderson_universe.others: Cartoon Cat, Long Horse, Bridge Worm, etc.

status.creator_confirmation: Trevor Henderson confirms it's his fictional character
status.belief_claims: Some people claim sightings despite fictional status
status.cultural_significance: Real as internet culture phenomenon, fictional as actual creature

sources.title: Trevor Henderson Twitter (@slimyswampghost)
sources.description: Original creator's social media with artwork and clarifications

sources.title: Various Sirenhead horror games
sources.description: itch.io, Steam, and mobile games featuring the character
